titles.title: Nana Maru San Batsu
7O3X Fastest Finger First
7O3X-0.01초의 싸움
7O3X
ナナマル サンバツ
Fastest Finger First
猜谜王

recommendations.recommendation: Its pretty good show with interesting characters and not ordinary theme, but it is only introduction to the world of Quizes without main character`s growth and proper end. 6/10

anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr26482 [Sugimoto Iqura]`s seinen manga series. The last thing freshman http://anidb.net/ch87981 [Koshiyama Shiki] expected was to be asked to join the Bunzo High School New Student Fast Finger Quiz Championship. A bookwork at heart, he hates being the center of attention and shudders at the mere thought of participating. To add insult to injury, his classmate http://anidb.net/ch87980 [Fukami Mari] overwhelms her competition by pressing the buzzer even before the entire question is read. It`s too late to hit the buzzer after you know the answer. A split second is all it takes to determine who wins or loses, she declares. After observing Mari for a while, Shiki discovers a way to determine the answers to a quiz. His world expands as he meets colleagues and senior members of the Quiz Club, as well as their formidable rival http://anidb.net/ch87982 [Mikuriya Chisato]. He experiences the joys of answering correctly and the frustrations of not getting to the buzzer quickly enough. He and his colleagues hone not only their knowledge, but also various techniques as they pursue victory in the world of competitive quiz. Source: ANN Note: The first two episodes received an early screening at a special event held at United Cinemas Aqua City Odaiba in Tokyo on 02.07.2017.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

episode.title: 謎の美少女登場ですが,
A Mysterious Beauty Appears,
Alors qu`une mystérieuse beauté apparaît...
수수께끼의 미소녀가 등장하는데,
Nazo no Bishoujo Toujou Desuga,
episode.summary: Shiki has experienced the fun and profound depths of quiz bowl. As he`s on his way to school with passion for quiz bowl on his mind, he catches sight of Sasajima with a girl on the back of his bicycle. Still wondering what his relationship with the girl is, Shiki and Inoue decide to join the quiz bowl circle. When Sasajima asks them if they have any questions after experiencing their first quiz meet, Mari raises her hand and asks, "How can we win in quiz bowl?!" Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 解答権が欲しければ/
If You Want the Right to Answer /
« Si tu veux avoir la main / »
해답권을 원한다면/
Kaitou Ken ga Hoshikereba/
episode.summary: The quiz meet between Sekigawata, Miyaura, Asagaoka, and Buzou High Schools has begun. Shiki and Mari have won their way through the first round, but Shiki struggles with some of the most commonly asked questions in quiz bowl, known as "classics." As Mikuriya Chisato of Miyaura High School keeps getting one right answer after another, Shiki is beginning to feel frustrated by his inability to predict the latter half of the questions given. Will he be able to buzz in when it comes down to it?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 0.01秒の世界!?
A Matter of 0.01 Seconds?!
Le monde en un centième de seconde ?!
0.01초의 세계!?
0.01 Byou no Sekai!?
episode.summary: Having discovered Shiki`s wealth of knowledge and quick thinking, Mari tries to get him to join the quiz bowl circle. Shiki is hesitant, but lets Mari talk him into accompanying her to Sekigawata High School to observe a quiz meet. Inoue Daisuke, who wants to get closer to Mari, also shows up... and it turns out both of them have already been entered in the meet by Sasajima! They`re about to have their first glimpse of the world of quiz bowl... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キミもクイズ王にならないか?
Don`t You Want to Become a Quiz King?
Et toi, si tu devenais le roi du quiz ?
자네도 퀴즈왕이 되지 않겠나?
Kimi mo Quiz-ou ni Naranaika?
episode.summary: Koshiyama Shiki, a new enrollee at Buzou High School, is a bookworm and quite the introverted type. He even eats lunch in the school library. But at the ceremony to welcome new students, he found himself volunteered to participate in an impromptu quiz meet by the quiz bowl circle`s leader, Sasajima Gakuto. Shiki knows the answers to all the questions, but it unable to buzz in quickly enough... until he notices a change in his classmate, Fukami Mari, who starts buzzing in to answer questions before they`ve even been read! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: \ごきげんよう/ 麻ヶ丘例会!
\Greetings/ Asagaoka Regular Meet!
\ Amusez-vous bien / à l`assemblée d`Asagaoka !
＼평안하신지요/ 아사가오카 정례회!
\Gokigen`you/ Asagaoka Reikai!
episode.summary: The regular meet at Asagaoka begins at last! In addition to Buzou, Miyaura, and Sekigawata, other participating teams include Yokohama`s Kannami University High School, whose quiz club`s president is Hanabusa Minoru, and Chiba`s Leoneil High School, whose club`s president is Tozuka Koutarou. Then the veteran team led by Ohkura Kunimitsu, the powerful Kaijou Academy, also arrives. Shiki and his teammates take on the first round, a paper quiz, and the second round, a fastest finger contest that divides the participants up into pairs! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ......ふたりの過去問
...Their Past Quiz Questions
Questions qui sont maintenant du passé...
......두사람의 기출문제
...... Futari no Kakomon
episode.summary: Mikuriya`s declaration of war to Shiki rings in his ears: "Don`t forget about the regular meet!" The regular meet is a regularly held quiz bowl tournament hosted alternately by several area schools. This year`s host is Asagaoka Girls` High School. It`s been decided that all the members of Buzou High`s quiz team, so they`re beginning a rigorous practice schedule. Meanwhile, Mari is asked why she got into quiz bowl, and tells the story of how her brother, Fukami Shinji, influenced her love of the activity. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: A.メイド B.チュウサ C.コアクマ
A. Maid B. Lieutenant Colonel C. Little Devil
A. Maid B. Lieutenant C. Petit démon
A.메이드 B.중사 C.소악마
A. Maid B. Chuusa C. Koakuma
episode.summary: As Mari and Kouzuki Yuki are working at their part-time job in Akihabara to earn money for a buzzer set, Shiki and Inoue arrive in the area to train themselves with a quiz bowl game in the arcade. They`re battling against a player called "Second Lieutenant Chisato" when Ashiya shows up, and the pair finds out that their opponent is someone they know quite well. Then a strange, somewhat suspicious character approaches the group... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 文蔵vs宮浦! ピコーン♪
Buzou vs Miyaura! Ding!
Buzô VS Miyaura ! Biiip ♪
부조 vs 미야우라! 띵동♪
Buzou vs Miyaura! Pikon
episode.summary: The girl Shiki met in the library was the same girl that he had seen riding on the back of Sasajima`s bike. The book she left behind has a marker stuck to the page on building quiz bowl buzzer systems. Is she involved with quiz bowl? As Shiki is thinking about all his, Mari tells him they`re having a joint quiz bowl practice with another school today. That school turns out to be Miyaura High, the team that claims Mikuriya as a member! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: A. そこにクイズがあるから!
A: Because the Question Is There!
A. Parce que le quiz est là !
그 곳에 퀴즈가 있으니까!
A. Soko ni Quiz ga Aru kara!
episode.summary: Round 3 of the regular meet at Asagaoka reaches its climax! Two have already emerged as winners, leaving room for only one more to advance to the next round! Shiki, Mikuriya, and Akira all use their unique abilities to the fullest as the intense back-and-forth battle continues. The contest for a seat in the semifinal round, with each player`s pride on the line, comes down to the final question... Who will emerge victorious?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Q. なぜ答えるのか?
Q: Why Do You Answer?
Comment faire pour répondre ?
왜 답을 맞히는가?
Q. Naze Kotaeru no ka?
episode.summary: It`s time for the second group in round 3 of the regular meet at Asagaoka! The showdown between rivals Shiki and Mikuriya finally becomes reality, but once again, Akira causes a commotion. Quiz bowl is no more than a game to him. Still, Mikuriya remains calm and proactively buzzes in to answer questions. Shiki also racks up points, determined not to let this match end like his last one. Will he succeed in taking revenge on Mikuriya?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とびきりの超エース様☆
The Unparalleled Super Ace
L’as des as ✭
끝내주는 슈퍼 에이스 님☆
Tobikiri no Chou Ace-sama
episode.summary: The intense second round of the regular meet at Asagaoka is over! Murmurs are still echoing in the venue over Akira`s provocative behavior as the contest enters round 3. The players are divided into two groups for a fastest finger board quiz. Sasajima and Mari are in the first group, but Mari is flustered when she learns that Sasajima was once a member of Kaijou`s quiz team. Does it have anything to do with why her brother quit quiz bowl? Her thoughts leave her unable to concentrate on the meet... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 王道 x 邪道
High Road x Low Road
Avec loyauté × Avec fourberie
왕도 x 사도
Oudou x Jadou
episode.summary: Round 2 of the regular meet at Asagaoka reaches its climax! This time it`s Shiki`s turn at the buzzer, and he`s determined to keep winning until he gets his revenge match against Mikuriya. He`s been paired with Sonohara Akira, a Sekigawata Middle School third-year. But in contrast to his cute appearance, Akira is quite a tricky player, throwing Shiki off his stride and bringing an atmosphere of unrest to the meet... Source: crunchyroll
